pt: {sc}insipid{/sc} {sc}vapid{/sc} {sc}flat{/sc} {sc}jejune{/sc} {sc}banal{/sc} {sc}inane{/sc} mean devoid of qualities that make for spirit and character. {sc}insipid{/sc} implies a lack of sufficient taste or savor to please or interest.

pt.t: an {it}insipid{/it} romance with platitudes on every page

pt: {sc}vapid{/sc} suggests a lack of liveliness, force, or spirit.

pt.t: an exciting story given a {it}vapid{/it} treatment

pt: {sc}flat{/sc} applies to things that have lost their sparkle or zest.

pt.t: although well-regarded in its day, the novel now seems {it}flat{/it}

pt: {sc}jejune{/sc} suggests a lack of rewarding or satisfying substance.
{sc}banal{/sc} stresses the complete absence of freshness, novelty, or immediacy.
{sc}inane{/sc} implies a lack of any significant or convincing quality.

quotes.t: Though feminist leaders are mostly aligned with those sentiments, they can't separate their quest for economic equity from the {qword}inane{/qword} political correctness of their extremist sisters.
All around us swirls the battering of gargantuan films, Styrofoam epics with megatons of special effects, gleefully {qword}inane{/qword} adolescent films, horror films that really are horrible.

The surfeit of home runs is a sop to all the Philistines who require {qword}inane{/qword} diversions like programmed races between electronic dots on the scoreboard to make it through a two-hit shutout.

shortdef: lacking significance, meaning, or point : silly

quotes.t: And thus likewise we sometimes speak of place, distance, or bulk in the great {qword}inane{/qword} beyond the confines of the world.
